body.p: DNA is a negatively charged molecule that binds with calcium (Ca2+) and magnesium (Mg2+)

response.feedback: Incorrect. the interaction of these charges is not a covalent bond.
Correct. The charged interactions here are ionic bonds.

part.hint: Which type of bonds are related to charges?

body.p: Within a protein, amino acids are linked by the bonding of carbon (C) to nitrogen (N)

response.feedback: Correct. This strong “peptide” bond holds proteins together.
Incorrect. Many macromolecules have carbon bonds since they are strong covalent bonds.

part.hint: Neither carbon nor nitrogen is highly electronegative or charged.
